intro: Euphorbia esula var. maglicensis, commonly known as the Magličan euphorbia, is a variant of the common spurge. It is a perennial plant native to the Balkan Peninsula, characterized by its succulent, spine-tipped leaves and a striking yellowish-green flower cluster. The plant thrives in rocky and arid environments, often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Its latex is toxic and can cause skin irritation, making it a cautionary plant for foragers. The species is also noted for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments.
